doc.field: Series 12: Development Office, Fund Raising, and Alumni records
Series 12: Development Office, Fund Raising, and Alumni records

This sub-series contains alumni questionnaires for the classes 1848 through 2002. Some files also contain alumni correspondence, news clippings, photographs, wills and testaments, and miscellaneous material (e.g. keepsakes albums, invitations, commencement programs, class materials, theater programs, and relating to alumni activities). Records regarding alumni funds, donations, bankbooks, correspondence relating to financial support of the institution are also included here. One unique item in this series is a birthday note written on birch bark by Mary Bond (class of 1886), dated 1901. Highlights include alumni information on notable students such as Mary White Ovington (1890), one of the early founders of what is now the NAACP; Elizabeth Woodbridge (1890), one of the first women to receive a PhD from Yale University; Ruth St. Denis (1898), pioneer modern dancer (nee Ruth Dennis); Lucy Burns (1899), suffragette; Janet Gale (1929), Pro-Choice Activist for Planned Parenthood; Nancy (Charlotte) Cushman (1933), Broadway actress; Sybil Hart Kooper (1945), Judge; Carin Vilonen, Miss Finlandia of 1966; Nancy Goliger (1968), Director of Adelphi University; and Maria Yatrakes (1999), Greek Olympic soccer player.
